snippet: The case of Colin McGinn, who agreed to leave the University of Miami after sexual harassment claims, has drawn scrutiny to a field that some say is rife with gender bias.
abstract: Revelation that Colin McGinn, star philosopher at the University of Miami, had agreed to leave his tenured post after allegations of sexual harassment brought by a graduate student, draws scrutiny to a field that some say is rife with gender bias; University of Massachusetts, Amherst, philosopher Louise Antony says reliance on debate in philosophy poses a particular dilemma for women, who are branded shrews if they argue aggressively and not good philosophers if they hold back.
lead_paragraph: The case of Colin McGinn, who agreed to leave the University of Miami after sexual harassment claims, has drawn scrutiny to a field that some say is rife with gender bias.

headline.main: A Star Philosopher Falls, and a Debate Over Sexism Is Set Off
